result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Court addressed the issue raise by Atty Kiefer on whether the Defendant could be responsible for the "victim's cause of death"; argument of counsel; Court reserved ruling on issue; State's motion for Daubert hearing on Defendant's expert testimony; argument of counsel; Court found no reason to not allow testimony of Defendant's expert; Defendant's motion for autopsy; Court found Atty Kiefer had not provided proper reason to conduct autopsy and reserved ruling on motion; Defendant's motion for Daubert hearing on State's expert testimony; argument by Atty Kiefer; Court denied motion; Atty Kiefer withdrew Defendant's motion as to AIT evidence; Court made rulings on State's and Defendant's motions in limine

defn motion to modify bond; argument by Atty Kiefer and ADA Olsen; ADA Olsen to remain as prosecutor and if defendant objects, Atty Kiefer should file motion; Defn found no conflict with Atty Kierfer remaining on as counsel; Bail amended to $25,000 cash bond - all other conditions remain the same

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT REFERRED TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $25,000. per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with the immediate family of Zachary J. or Davina J.

from Deputy DA Viste in response to the defendant's motion to withdraw plea

Reporter:  Colleen Clark
on Defendant's motion to withdraw her plea; State had no objection to the motion being granted with the understanding that all charges and/or enhancers that were dismissed as part of the plea agreement be reinstated; Atty Olsen advised the District Attorney's Office had contacted the Attorney General's Office to inquire if it would be ethical for their office to prosecute the case given Atty Helmberger's employment there or if a special prosecutor should be appointed; Court had colloquy with Defendant about the ramifications if she were allowed to withdraw her plea and based upon her understanding, granted motion (plead guilty on ct 1 w/ repeater dismissed); Court ordered any dismissal or amendment to the charged offenses or enhancers be vacated and reinstated as filed in the Information; Court reinstated bail as previously set with same conditions
multiple statements filed; copies to defense attys were provided by DA's office
to withdraw plea from Atty Kiefer
of Karley Lamphier submitted by Atty Kiefer
